meanings.definition: To shout or call out loudly to someone
meanings.sent1: I hollooed to my friend across the field.
meanings.sent2: She hollooed for help when she got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The little boy hollooed with excitement when he saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent4: Her words hollooed through the empty hallway, echoing off the walls.
meanings.sent5: The coach hollooed instructions to the players, urging them to keep pushing forward.

meanings.definition: A loud cry or shout to attract attention
meanings.sent1: The holloo of the lifeguard alerted everyone to the swimmer in trouble.
meanings.sent2: We heard a distant holloo coming from the top of the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The sudden holloo from the audience surprised the performers on stage.
meanings.sent4: The holloo of the referee signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent5: The loud holloo of the fire alarm sent everyone rushing out of the building.
